entries.meaning: A roll of banknotes or other paper currency, carried in lieu of a wallet.
examples: Phil kept his bankroll in his front pocket, as it made too much of a lump to sit on.

entries.meaning: The monetary assets of a person or organization.
examples: Microsoft is a corporation with an extremely large bankroll.

verbs.description: bankroll (third-person singular simple present bankrolls, present participle bankrolling, simple past and past participle bankrolled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To fund a project; to underwrite something.
examples: Professor Stebbins didn't need to apply for government grants because his lab was bankrolled by a large pharmaceutical corporation.
